meanings.definition: To give all or a large part of one's time or resources to a particular activity or person.
meanings.sent1: She is devoting her weekends to volunteering at the animal shelter.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys devoting his evenings to reading books.
meanings.sent3: The cat, devoting all its attention to the laser pointer, pounced playfully.
meanings.sent4: The sun, devoting its rays to the flowers, made them bloom beautifully.
meanings.sent5: By devoting himself to practice, he became a skilled musician.

meanings.definition: To dedicate or consecrate something to a specific purpose or cause.
meanings.sent1: The artist is devoting this painting to his late grandmother.
meanings.sent2: They are devoting their efforts to raising awareness about climate change.
meanings.sent3: The cake, devoting its sweetness to delighting taste buds, was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: The river, devoting its flow to carving through rocks, created a beautiful canyon.
meanings.sent5: By devoting the garden to growing vegetables, they ensured a fresh supply all year round.
